home.welcome-title: Hello! This is the Siemens Organizational Cosmos
home.welcome-message: It visualizes and unifies information about our organization, teams and peers. Use the entire platform to identify what we do, where we do it, and how we have come together to do it. We invite you to become a Cosmologist, begin your exploration by searching or directly navigating through the dedicated view.
home.update-info: Visit our News section and have a look what we have been working on lately.
home.v2020-welcome-message: The Planning OrgCharts reflect the planning status of the organizational setup valid as of April 1, 2019. Legally binding until March 31, 2019 is the current organizational structure.

v2020plus-welcome-dialog.headline:
Welcome to the
Vision 2020+ Planning OrgCharts
v2020plus-welcome-dialog.text:
The Planning OrgCharts* reflect the planning status of the organizational setup valid as of April 1, 2019.

General remarks
  • The current organization will stay in place and is legally binding until March 31, 2019. The Planning OrgCharts are for your information only.
  • EVERY employee will have a place in the new organization as of April 1, 2019.
  • Should you not find your name in the Planning OrgCharts it is due to a technical issue. Please speak first to your manager who will then get in a second step in contact with the responsible HR Business Partner.
  • There will be weekly updates of the Planning OrgCharts.
  • Note that the Planning OrgCharts will not display footnotes, Business Partners and Special Responsibilities, etc. (see also FAQs).
v2020plus-welcome-dialog.text_note: * Subject to change and only for visualizing and transparency reasons.

v2020plus-orgmanager.footer_text: Currently subject to information and consultation with workers representatives. For visualizing and transparency reasons only. Subject to change.

orgCharts.title: Welcome to the
orgCharts.subtitle: This application visualizes the functional Siemens organization and management structures. Use it to find information about departments, teams, the individuals within them, and how to contact them.

bmd.title: Portfolio View -
bmd.subtitle-1: The Portfolio-View offers a structured summary about the entrepreneurial responsibility of the Business Units. Vertically, it reflects our Electrification, Automation and Digitalization strategy pillars and horizontally, it shows the power value chain from generation to consumption. And finally: all service offerings are grouped within the relevant product portfolio area.
bmd.subtitle-2-bl: Please note! We are still working on the integration of the DF- and PD-Portfolios, so for now further info on these is available

snackbar.insert: Job tag saved! Review and edit in the "My Job Tags" section.

jobinterests-tagging-dialog.p1: I'm interested in future vacancies of this department.
jobinterests-tagging-dialog.checkbox_public_label: Tag is visible for the manager of this Org Unit
jobinterests-tagging-dialog.textarea_comment_placeholder: Please note: This comment will be visible too, if you decided to make the Job Tag visible!
jobinterests-tagging-dialog.text:
Please also check current open vacancies in the job market tool (Avature / Taleo) for real time matches.

If an open vacancy is posted, you will receive a system notification and more information to follow the standard application process. If you are interested, you will need to apply to be considered.

step2.title: Job tag saved for
step2.text:
This tag is only valid for this specific department, not the organizational structure below! You can review and edit this tag at any time in the "My Job Tags" section.

As soon as an open vacancy is posted, you will receive a notification (this may take a while depending on the open job situation in the tagged department) and more information to follow the standard application process. If you are interested, you will need to apply to be considered.

jobinterests-welcome-dialog.headline:
Welcome to Job Tagging.
An experiment
jobinterests-welcome-dialog.subheadline: Within the Organization Charts you can now add your interest in a department.
jobinterests-welcome-dialog.text:
Start by turning on the Job tagging feature. Then hover over the Org Unit you are interested in and click the "Add tag" button to tag your interest.

Next select the level within the organization you are interested in and if you want to, you can share your interest with the manager of this unit. You may also choose to add a comment that will be visible to the manager of this department.

Once completed, your tag will be saved in your personal 'My Job Tags' section. There you will be able to review and edit your tags and set notification alerts. If a job ad is posted within a department you have tagged, you will receive a system notification that directs you to the standard job application process. If you are interested, you will need to apply to be considered.

Job Tagging is currently a beta feature and not yet available for employees in Canada and France.

jobinterests-disclaimer-dialog.headline: Job Tagging - Disclaimer
jobinterests-disclaimer-dialog.text:
Adding Interest data in the Siemens Organizational Cosmos (SOC) can only be done by an employee for his own profile. Renewing or deleting the information on the "My Job Tags" page is always possible. You are personally responsible for the maintenance of the data.

Engaging in the Job tagging mode does not provide an expressed interest in any position nor does it guarantee consideration or placement in any position. It only conveys an interest to learn more about and network within the identified organization.

Data Privacy Consent
Siemens Aktiengesellschaft, Werner-von-Siemens-Straße 1, 80333 Munich, Germany ("Siemens") operates the Job Tagging Feature which allows employees to express interest in a position at a certain Organizational Unit by tagging this respective Organizational Unit in the Organization Charts. If you decide to express your interest through the Job Tagging Feature, Siemens collects and processes the following personal data about you ("Your Data"):

  • Information contained in your SOC profile, such as your full name, GID, your current Organizational Unit;
  • Organizational Unit tagged by you; and
  • Comments posted by you when tagging a position.

After your tagging of a certain Organizational Unit, the respective manager of the Organizational Unit will be informed of your interest and Your Data will be visible to this manager, if you select the option of your tag being visible to this manager. You can review your current tags, update or remove your tags at any time within the SOC by visiting the "My Job Tags" page. If you do not update a tag for a period of two years, the respective tag will be deleted. You may also revoke your consent declared hereunder within your settings which leads to the full deletion of all your tags. For further information on Siemens’ privacy practices, including information on your data privacy related rights, please visit the Siemens Intranet Privacy Notice.
jobinterests-disclaimer-dialog.checkbox_label: I consent to the collection and processing of my personal data as described herein.
jobinterests-disclaimer-dialog.checkbox_label_error: You have to agree in order to continue.
jobinterests-disclaimer-dialog.text_2: The consent is valid for the duration of my employment relationship. I may revoke my consent at any time with future effect here.

tooltip.SOC20.Department.Combined.List: The Org Code is usually an abbreviation derived from the Org Name. With regards to its composition, the Org Code displays the hierarchical position of an Org Unit within the Siemens organization and the function or responsibility of an Org Unit.
tooltip.SOC20.SpecialResponsibilities.List: Special Responsibilities are functions such as officers/coordinators that are not integrated in the Org Unit for which they perform tasks and functions, but are members of another Org Unit.
tooltip.SOC20.OrgClass.List: The Org Class classifies an Org Units’ responsibility. Each Org Unit needs to be assigned to one Org Class that describes the focus of an Org Unit's activities; e.g. Org Unit with focus Sales -> Org Class: Sales.
tooltip.SOC20.OrgUnit.List: An Organizational Unit (Org Unit) is an element of the organization structure.
tooltip.SOC20.JobFamily.List: A Sub Job Family is the breakdown of a Job Family. This is done for the reason to cluster tasks in more detail along the value chain of the Job Family. For Engineering e.g. “General Engineering” or “Systems Engineering”, etc.
tooltip.SOC20.Position.List: Org Positions define the role of a person within an Organizational Unit. There are various different Org Positions as defined by GM ORG e.g. Employee, Head, CEO, CFO, CDL, CDC.
tooltip.SOC20.Department.Tree: The Org Code is usually an abbreviation derived from the Org Name. With regards to its composition, the Org Code displays the hierarchical position of an Org Unit within the Siemens organization and the function or responsibility of an Org Unit.
tooltip.SR: Special Responsibilities are functions such as officers/coordinators that are not integrated in the Org Unit for which they perform tasks and functions, but are members of another Org Unit.
